member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.RowIndicatorBrightness
member.summary: Property to set the brightness level of the corresponding row of LED indicators, where Row 1 is the top row and Row 3 is the bottom row. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0% (no brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.RowBacklightBrightness
member.summary: Property to set the backlight brightness level of the corresponding row, where Row 1 is the top row and Row 3 is the bottom row. The backlight illuminates the labels over each button. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0% (no brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.IRInputPort
member.summary: IR input port on the device. Valid IRIDs range from 0x00 to 0x3F.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.LightSensorChange
member.summary: Event triggered when the ambient light level as a percentage from 0% to 100% is reported as determined by the internal light sensor.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.LightSensorValue
member.summary:
Property to report the ambient light level detected by the internal photo sensor.
The event will trigger with and . Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
member.remarks: Reported values range from 0% (no light) to 100% (maximum light).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.IndicatorIntensity
member.summary: Property to set the brightness level of the bargraph. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0% (no brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.MpBBase.BargraphValue
member.summary: Property to set the value of the 5-segment bargraph, as follows: 0% = No segment illuminated 1% - 20% = Segment 1 ON 21% - 40% = Segments 1 and 2 ON 41% - 60% = Segments 1-3 ON 61% - 80% = Segments 1-4 ON 81% - 100% = Segments 1-5 ON Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.summary: When this property is set 'false', the device will control the slave output line wire to another dimmer or switch. If set to 'true', the device will operate the button only as a remote logic (send button state information only). If the is to , this property has no effect.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.HzKpex.ParameterLocalButtonStatusFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to define what LED(s) are turned on when the load is on (level above zero percent) or off.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.HzKpex.ParameterLocalButtonActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Parameter to define the behavior of the LED(s) when a local button is pressed to turn on or off a load. LED(s) can either flash, enable, or do nothing, disable. The timing of the blink is set by .
For quick ramps to the preset level or 100% which take place within a second, the LED will flash at least one transition and end up at on or off state. For a manual raise/lower operation where the button is held down, it will continue to flash while the button is held down, but stop once the ramp is completed and ended at the target level.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.CnxBn12
member.summary:
Cresnet based elegant wallmount designer keypad with 12 large buttons, optional backlighting, built-in audio feedback and temperature sensing. This is an optional complement to the CNX-BF12 Function Keypad, allowing for enhanced control of a Crestron Multiroom AV distribution system with direct numeric entry for the selection of channels and tracks. It also works well for pass code entry applications.
This class will trigger and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.CnxBf12
member.summary:
Cresnet based elegant wallmount designer keypad with 12 large buttons, optional backlighting, built-in audio feedback and temperature sensing. Provides a simple solution for controlling a Crestron Multiroom AV distribution system. It is identical to the CNX-B12 12-Button Designer Keypad except that it includes a set of 30 assorted button caps pre-labeled for AV source selection and basic control functions.
This class will trigger and events.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLedStates.SolidBlue
member.summary: Solid Blue, indicates no video source is connected.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLedStates.BlinkingGreen
member.summary: Blinking Green, indicates a video source is connected and the display device is powering up.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLedStates.SolidGreen
member.summary: Solid Green, indicates the connected video source is selected for viewing on the display device.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLedStates.SlowlyPulsatingGreen
member.summary: Slowly Pulsating Green, indicates a video source is connected but not currently selected for viewing

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLedStates.BlinksRedFiveTimes
member.summary: Blinks Red Five Times, indicates one of the Connect It buttons has been pressed but no video source is connected

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLedStates.SolidRed
member.summary: Solid Red, user defined - has no predefined firmware functionality associated with this state. This is available starting with firmware version 1.3204.00000 and higher. This led state is not supported for TT2-100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdex.ParameterBargraphTimeout
member.summary: Sets and gets the BargraphTimeout parameter. Valid values are between 0 to 10 seconds Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdex.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Returns and sets the time in seconds that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdex.ParameterDblTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DblTap" to be recognized. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdex.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a "DblTap" event occurs.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.ManualIndicatorIntensity
member.summary: Enables manual adjustment of the LED brightness via the IndicatorIntensity input for as long as the input is true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.ReportLightLevel
member.summary: Enables the LightSensorValue property and the LightSensorChange event output to report the current light level for as long as the input is true. When the input is false the light level isn't reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.BrightnessSettings
member.summary: Returns a BrightnessSettings instance that can be used to get and set brightness settings.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.BacklightIntensity
member.summary: Property that returns a reference to the BacklightIntensity UShortInputSig.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.EnableExtThreshold
member.summary: When EnableExtThreshold is true, this puts the keypad into slave mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.AboveThreshold
member.summary: This input is driven by the AboveThreshold_FB output on the master keypad. This input is only active when EnableExtThreshold is set to true, which signifies that the current button is operating in slave mode. When the input goes true, this sets the backlight to the specified Day level (either custom or preset). When the input goes false, it goes to the specified Night level (custom or preset).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.AboveThresholdFeedback
member.summary: Updated to indicate the level of the ambient light in relation to the threshold. This field is only updated when EnableExtThreshold is set to false.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nCbdPBase.ThresholdStateChange
member.summary: Event triggered when the reports ambient light is at or below or above the threshold, this event is only raised when is set to false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nUni8IoBase.FeedbackIntensity
member.summary: Property to set the LED feedback level when the corresponding feedback sig value is 'true'.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 25% to 100%. Out of range values will hold the feedback level to the minimum/maximum value. If a value of 0% is sent, or if the property value is undefined, the feedback intensity will default to 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nUni8IoBase.GlowIntensity
member.summary: Property to set the glow intensity, which illuminates the keypad when the corresponding LED feedback is turned off, and glow mode is enabled.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 1% to 20%. Out of range values will hold the feedback level to the minimum/maximum value. If a value of 0% is sent, or if the property value is undefined, the glow intensity will default to 10%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nUni8IoBase.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Returns and sets the time in seconds that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nUni8IoBase.ParameterDblTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DblTap" to be recognized. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.C2nUni8IoBase.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a "DblTap" event occurs.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HttB10Ex.LeftBargraph
member.summary:
Property to get the left bar graph analog value that will be displayed on the corresponding LED indicators in bargraph format.
The Left bargraph is formed by the LEDs on the left side of the unit; the Right bargraph, by the LEDs on the right side.
parameter shall specify the amount of time a bargraph is displayed. A value of 0 shall indicate no timeout such that indicators shall always function in bargraph mode.
The LEDs will display the ramping value as it changes, and then remain in bargraph mode for the additional period given by the parameter.
If no change occurs to the analog value before the expires, the LEDs revert to standard behavior.
The 5-segment bargraph displays the analog values as follows:
Segment 1 (top) LED is ON when analog value = 100%.
Segment 2 LED is ON when analog value > 75%.
Segment 3 LED is ON when analog value > 50%.
Segment 4 LED is ON when analog value > 25%.
Segment 5 (bottom) LED is ON when analog value > 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HttB10Ex.RightBargraph
member.summary:
Property to get the right bar graph value that will be displayed on the corresponding LED indicators in bargraph format.
The Right bargraph is formed by the LEDs on the left side of the unit; the Right bargraph, by the LEDs on the right side.
The LEDs will display the ramping value as it changes, and then remain in bargraph mode for the additional period given by the parameter.
If no change occurs to the analog value before the expires, the LEDs revert to standard behavior.
The 5-segment bargraph displays the analog values as follows:
Segment 1 (top) LED is ON when analog value = 100%.
Segment 2 LED is ON when analog value > 75%.
Segment 3 LED is ON when analog value > 50%.
Segment 4 LED is ON when analog value > 25%.
Segment 5 (bottom) LED is ON when analog value > 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HttB10Ex.ParameterBargraphTimeout
member.summary:
Parameter to access the bargraph timeout value on the LED indicators in bargraph format.
The LED indicators will enter bargraph mode as soon as a new value is seen on .
The LEDs will adjust as the analog value is ramping and then remain in bargraph mode for the additional period.
Valid values range from 0s to 10s and default is 3s.

Valid values range from 10s through 300s(5 minutes) and default is 120s(2 minutes).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HttB10Ex.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Returns and sets the time in seconds that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid values are 20 (0.2s) to 100 (1.0s) and default is 50(0.5s).
member.exception: Specified value is out of range

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HttB10Ex.ParameterDblTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DblTap" to be recognized. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid values are 20 (0.2s) to 100 (1.0s) and default is 50(0.5s).
member.exception: Specified value is out of range

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HttB10Ex.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary:
Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a "DblTap" event occurs.
When set to 'true', the user will incur a slight delay before seeing the Tap, but when a DblTap occurs, there will be no Tap event.
When set to 'false'(default), the user will see the quickest response from the Tap event, but will also see a Tap event prior to each DblTap event.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.EutechProlightKeypad.ProximityDetectedFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report if an object or the operator (for example, the operator's hand) is near, in proximity of, the keypad. Proximity is turned on when an object or the operator is approximately 3 to 7 cm away from the glass of the Eutech Prolight Keypad. Proximity stays activated for all the time the object is near Eutech Prolight Keypad and for an additional 10-15 seconds when the object is pulled away. True = Object or operator (user) near keypad, False = Object or operator (user) not near keypad.
This property will trigger event with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.EutechProlightKeypad.CleaningModeOnFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report if Cleaning mode is currently turned on. Cleaning mode is turned on by touching the Eutech Prolight Keypad with the open hand placed horizontally in the space between the 3 lower keys and the interior edge for about 8 seconds. The cleaning mode status is useful for Crestron macros to avoid reading key presses, for example when the operator wants to clean the glass of the Eutech Prolight Keypad, without activating the keys. True = Cleaning Mode On, False = Cleaning Mode off.
This property will trigger event with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.EutechProlightKeypad.TemperatureFeedback
member.summary:

This property will trigger event with .

member.summary:

member.summary: Updated with the ambient light level. ReportLightLevel must be set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.ManualBacklight
member.summary: Enables manual adjustment of the backlight via the BacklightIntensity input for as long as the input is true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.ManualIndicatorIntensity
member.summary: Enables manual adjustment of the LED brightness via the IndicatorIntensity input for as long as the input is true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.ReportLightLevel
member.summary: Enables the LightSensorValue property and the LightSensorChange event output to report the current light level for as long as the input is true. When the input is false the light level isn't reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.BrightnessSettings
member.summary: Returns a BrightnessSettings instance that can be used to get and set brightness settings.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.BacklightIntensity
member.summary: Property that returns a reference to the BacklightIntensity UShortInputSig.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.EnableExtThreshold
member.summary: When EnableExtThreshold is true, this puts the keypad into slave mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.AboveThreshold
member.summary: This input is driven by the AboveThreshold_FB output on the master keypad. This input is only active when EnableExtThreshold is set to true, which signifies that the current button is operating in slave mode. When the input goes true, this sets the backlight to the specified Day level (either custom or preset). When the input goes false, it goes to the specified Night level (custom or preset).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.AboveThresholdFeedback
member.summary: Updated to indicate the level of the ambient light in relation to the threshold. This field is only updated when EnableExtThreshold is set to false.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.InetCbdexP.ThresholdStateChange
member.summary: Reports when ambient light is at or below or above the threshold. This event is only raised when EnableExtThreshold is set to false.
